thread.title: Bruins sign Travis Roy to one-day contract | Bruins Insider |
thread.title_full: Bruins sign Travis Roy to one-day contract | Bruins Insider | | Boston Herald

author: Herald Staff
title: Bruins sign Travis Roy to one-day contract | Bruins Insider |
text:
Travis Roy is now a member of the Bruins.
The Bruins signed the former BU hockey player to a one-day contract on Monday as the team honored him on the ice before a matinee against Tampa.
This month marks the 20th anniversary of the on-ice injury that left Roy paralyzed as a BU freshman.
Roy, donning a Bruins jersey, dropped the ceremonial puck before today's game.
The Bruins also made a $50,000 donation to the Travis Roy Foundation, which aims to help those dealing with spinal cord injuries.
Travis Roy dropped the puck prior to #TBLvsBOS . Read more about his story: http://t.co/FPlrfHxQRD pic.twitter.com/a4hCdQR9ci
â€” NHL (@NHL) October 12, 2015
